intG_tria3.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /******************************************************************************
00002 * File      : intG_tria3.c                                                    *
00003 * Author    : Carlos Rosales Fernandez (carlos@ihpc.a-star.edu.sg)            *
00004 * Date      : 01-09-2006                                                      *
00005 * Revision  : 1.0                                                             *
00006 *******************************************************************************
00007 * DESCRIPTION                                                                 *
00008 * Computes the integral of the Green's function G for one element and returns *
00009 * the integrals in vector Int[] for all shape functions.                      *
00010 * Works for linear interpolation in triangular elements (3-noded triangles).  *
00011 ******************************************************************************/
00012

00036 #include "integral_tria3.h"
00037 
00038 int intG_tria3(double X[3][3], double *Xeval, double *Int)
00039 {
00040     unsigned int i;
00041     double A, dx, dy, dz, J, W;
00042     double L[2], N[3], XL[3];
00043 
00044     /* Initialize */
00045     Int[0] = Int[1] = Int[2] = 0.0; 
00046 
00047     /* Integrate using Gauss-Legendre quadrature */
00048     for(i = 0; i < TNGAUSS; i++){
00049         L[0] = TGauss[i][0];
00050         L[1] = TGauss[i][1];
00051         W = TGauss[i][2];
00052 
00053         /* Shape functions N and Jacobian J for these (L1,L2) values */
00054         shape_tria3(L,N);       
00055         J = X2L_tria3(X,XL,L,N);
00056 
00057         /* Auxiliar quantities */
00058         dx = Xeval[0] - XL[0];
00059         dy = Xeval[1] - XL[1];
00060         dz = Xeval[2] - XL[2];
00061         A = W*J/sqrt(dx*dx + dy*dy + dz*dz);
00062 
00063         /* Add contribution for each node in this element */
00064         Int[0] += A*N[0];
00065         Int[1] += A*N[1];
00066         Int[2] += A*N[2];  
00067     }
00068 
00069     return 0;
00070 }
